chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (10th or More) and Operating w/ PAC (10th+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (10th or More) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (10th+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Todd M Lowery was found guilty of OWI (10th or More), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 12.5 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. DNA surcharge assessed. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Seach for employment. Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.

Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may not have any alcohol in or on the premises of home.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including alcohol and drug counseling.  Do not drive unless properly licensed. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

***DEFENDANT TO BE HELD WITHOUT BOND PENDING SENTENCING.***
Sentencing hearing on May 18, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Todd M Lowery in court with attorney Dirk Christian Jensen.  Defendant Todd M Lowery in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod for Patricia Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State has filed an amended complaint and an amended information.
Reading of complaint is waived and will stand moot at this time.
BTC: probable cause found.
Plea - Ct.1 - NC.
BTC: Ct.1 - GUILTY.   Ct.2 - DRI.  Ct.3 - Dismissed.
BTC:PSI ordered, Bond revoked.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's
Pre-trial conference on February 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.
NG plea entered.
Reading waived.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Todd M Lowery in court with attorney Dirk Christian Jensen.  Defendant Todd M Lowery in custody.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Dirk Jensen
Racine County Pretrial Screening Report
Preliminary hearing on February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   Do not drive at all. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Todd M Lowery in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Todd M Lowery in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
